page.title: 09V.E.Day and Forty Years On
page.content: It was 11 o'clock on the 8th May 1945 when the people of Presteigne heard that the{Second World War}was over.They heard the news on the {radio.Street parties}were were organised and a{bonfire}was lit that evening on a hill outside the town.The town raised money for the soldiers and gave them so much each. During the war the church tower was used as a{look out post.}They looked for enemy aeroplanes to find out in which direction they were going.The local die castings factory made{bullets. To celebrate the{40th anniversary {of V.E.Day}a dinner and dance was held at the{Memorial Hall,}which was built as the town's memorial to the men from this area, who died during the war.
